description: The&nbsp;Last Word is one of those old cocktails from the 30s that you find on a drink menu. It tells you, “We’re not kidding around here! This drink has&nbsp;gin mixed with green Chartreuse, maraschino liqueur, and lime juice.We based ours on this classic but changed up some ingredients too: our version uses American Single Malt liquor (instead of Scotch) because it’s “smooth yet strong.”This beverage mixes with Tattersall Amaro from Minneapolis, and yellow Chartreuse. It’s also juiced with a splash of Meyer lemons, which are more savory than regular lemons and blends well with the single malt whiskey. This drink will take your taste buds on a wild ride!
name: S.T.F.U
recipeIngredient: ¾ oz. Ranger Creek Rimfire Mesquite Smoked Texas Single Malt Whiskey
¾ oz. Meyer lemon juice freshly squeezed

recipeInstructions.name: Mix all ingredients in a cocktail shaker.
recipeInstructions.text: Mix all ingredients in a cocktail shaker.

recipeInstructions.name: Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with Meyer lemon curl.
